page.title: 05CHANGES IN TRANSPORT
page.content: Lydbrook_Changes in Transport.Lydbrook is a village in a rural area and as such transport to the main towns of Cinderford,Coleford,Ross_on_Wye and Lydney is important to the local inhabitants for shopping and leisure activities.Recently,transport by bus or coach has changed from being run by national companies to smaller privately owned ones.Dean Forest coaches at Joys Green operates in the area and has the contract for school transport.There is a good bus service to Cinderford,6 running in the morning,4 in the evenings with an extra bus on Friday evenings.There are 7 buses throughout the day to Ross_on_ Wye.There are 5 buses to Coleford during the week.There was a station at Lydbrook,which closed about 1954.Goods trains ran to Cinderford,Monmouth and Ross_on_Wye but was closed about 1930.
